characterDescription:
Amaram's cook is likely highly ranked for a darkeyes, according to Shallan, and an important member of his household staff.
Never looking up from her novel, she asks of Shallan (who is disguised as a servant) why she's back at Amaram's manor already, and tells her that she shouldn't think that 'they' hadn't noticed her sneaking off during midday, referring to her as "child."
She tells Shallan that just because the master is fond of her, it doesn't mean she can take advantage. She tells Shallan to go to work. That spending her free evening cleaning instead of playing might remind her that she has duties.

characterDetails.Appearance: As the cook slowly lowers her novel, her frown seems the type that one doesn't disobey ... again, according to Shallan.
